author: LNW
text:
Here is what the facts are:

1.  I was told once I sent in my bag, it would be authenticated.  The set sales price would then be emailed to me      & I could either accept it or have my bag returned to me.

2.  I was given a UPS label from Nichole, which didn’t work & I was unable to reach her, so UPS created a new label with TRR’s info from their system.  I then contacted Nichole with a copy of the new tracking number from UPS, on 3/21/22.  She confirmed receipt 3/21/22.  Therefore, she had a tracking number to LINK TO MY PACKAGE BEFORE IT ARRIVED, which she states later is how TRR keeps track of them in house.

3.   UPS delivers package to TRR on 3/24/22

4.  She doesn’t respond to my calls or texts until 3/29/22, when she asks for a copy of the shipping label, provided to her on 3/21/22, then says that must be the problem.  She says she will need to open a support ticket, but the UPS tracking number that she had on 3/21, was the issue for “the disconnect”.

5.  Nichole didn’t turn in the support ticket, according to reps I spoke to later, nor did she return/answer phone calls or texts again.

6.  4/01/22 I spoke to rep #2 who looked for my information/bag/ticket & found nothing.  She found the ticket created by Nichole on Nichole’s desk, her words not mine & the ticket had not been entered into the system.  She said she would do it.

7.  4/06/22 I call again & speak to rep #3.  She also does not find ANY action to find my bag.  She says she will take over my case & find out what is going on.

8.   4/12/22 i speak to Steven who asks me to send him pictures of my bag so he can look into it.  I send them.  He says he will get something done & get back to me.

9.   4/14/22 I get an email saying my bag is enroute to the authenticator & it would be a couple of weeks before I would hear back.  Their policy states & I was confirmed, that after it was authenticated, I would be contacted with a proposed sales price which I could accept or ask to have my bag sent back to me.

10.  4/15/22. I get an email saying my bag was sold & I would be getting a payout.

**It was not sold, it was deemed as LOST, which means you get whatever they deem the bag to be worth at 50-70%.  You have zero say in the matter!**

This entire process was deceptive.  TRR seems to do this on a regular basis to many of their consignors.  Please look into their practices.  Read their FB comments.  This happens over & over again, same scenario as mine.
 There are many other platforms to sell on who pay more & at much less risk.  Please, don’t take my word for it but do your research…THIS IS A RECURRING PROBLEM WITH THEM.  Read their own FB page comments.
  (I’d be happy to share evidence of every single statement I made.)
title: Consigning with The Real Real, DON’T
